intro: Hosackia chihuahuana, commonly known as the Chihuahua milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America, particularly in Texas and New Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
